message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper proposes a method for creating document representations that reflect their internal structure, which is a common problem in natural language processing and information retrieval. The paper focuses on using Tree-LSTMs to hierarchically merge basic elements like words and sentences into blocks of increasing complexity, which is a technique commonly used in deep learning for natural language processing. The paper also emphasizes the usefulness of Tree-LSTMs for texts larger than a sentence, which is a common problem in document classification. Based on these factors, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Other likely sub-categories include cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.CV (Computer Vision), as these fields also deal with natural language processing and document analysis.
